instructions.title: How to use XML to JSON Converter

steps.title: Paste or upload your XML
steps.description: Copy and paste your XML data into the input area, or click Upload to select an XML file from your computer. The tool supports XML declarations, namespaces, and CDATA sections.

steps.title: Configure conversion options
steps.description: Choose your preferred output format: enable pretty print for readable JSON, toggle compact attributes for smaller output, enable smart arrays for repeated elements, and activate type conversion for numbers and booleans.

steps.title: Convert and review output
steps.description: Click 'Convert to JSON' to process your XML. Review the formatted JSON output and check the metadata panel for size comparisons and processing statistics.

steps.title: Copy or download result
steps.description: Use the Copy button to copy JSON to your clipboard, or Download to save it as a .json file for use in your applications.

proTips: Enable smart arrays when XML has repeated elements to create proper JSON arrays
Use compact attributes mode to reduce JSON output size by 20-30%
Remove namespaces when working with internal data that doesn't need them
Enable type conversion to get proper number/boolean types instead of strings
Process large XML files by disabling pretty print for faster conversion
Use the sample XML to understand how different options affect output structure
troubleshooting: Parsing errors: Ensure XML is well-formed with matching opening and closing tags
Missing data: Check if CDATA sections contain your content and are being preserved
Unexpected structure: Toggle array mode to see if repeated elements should be arrays
Wrong data types: Enable type conversion to convert string numbers to actual numbers
Namespace issues: Try enabling 'Remove Namespaces' to simplify output structure
Large files slow: Disable pretty print and process in smaller chunks if needed
